messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tom Cruise's worst movie
messages.messageBody:
<< I know some will disagree, but I couldn't live with myself unless I spoke
up: This was the Worst Movie Ever. It was so boring that Craig and I fast
forwarded, trying to find anything slightly titillating. >> (> 1999: Eyes
Wide Shut)

I SO agree. I was stunned that they had released it. That they had even
finished editing it, it was so lame.

Oh my gosh...me too!
That was the WORST movie I've ever seen period. I kept watching it wondering when it was going to "pick up".

I was also surprised at the "soft porn" part of it (part? geez thats all there was :o)). I mean, if they're gonna do porn stuff, they might as well just call it what it is and get the right producers for it. It might have turned out better. (Gag)

Kristen



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Tom Cruise's worst movie
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/1/03 7:19:09 AM, sjogy@sbcglobal.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/1/03 7:19:09 AM, sjogy@... writes:

<< I know some will disagree, but I couldn't live with myself unless I spoke
up: This was the Worst Movie Ever. It was so boring that Craig and I fast
forwarded, trying to find anything slightly titillating. >> (> 1999: Eyes
Wide Shut)

I SO agree. I was stunned that they had released it. That they had even
finished editing it, it was so lame.

The real question was which Tom Cruise movies Holly might like. She wouldn't
like that one. <g> Nor Mission Impossible.

Since Keith loves bombs and westerns and Holly loves musicals and fantasies,
what they watch together are things like Paint Your Wagon. <g>

Sandra
